title: 5 Pieces of Financial Advice I Ignore Daily
subtitle: Learn from the common pitfalls and misconceptions that can hinder your financial journey.
content:
5 Pieces of Financial Advice I Ignore Daily

If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free newsletter by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Buy a $700,000 Duplex

Because my barber, Silas, said it was a tax haven.

2. Invest in Meme Coins or NFTs

I've been advised to invest $100,000 in meme coins or NFTs because my cousin, Lenny, insisted that Donkey Coin is different.

3. Hire an Investment Advisor

Paying 1% of my assets to Dex Callahan so he can pretend to beat the stock market and call me annually to ask how my kids are doing. I don't even have kids.

4. Buy a Whole Life Policy

Paying Cole Vickers, an insurance agent, for a whole life policy or an IUL, even though I only need life insurance to cover my dependents until they no longer depend on me, a.k.a. term life.

5. Following the Crowd

Pretending I get an investment just because the world's doing the same. It's okay to say, I don't know. It's even more okay to say, and for those reasons, I'm out.
